name: nuclear power plant construction, pressure water reactor 650MW | nuclear power plant, pressure water reactor, 650MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11811/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of a pressure water nuclear plant .This dataset is based on study on the production, transport and distribution of electricity in Quebec.  ;The CANDU (CANada Deuterium Uranium) technology was used to built this nuclear power plant. This nuclear technology is characterized by the use of heavy water as moderator and natural uranium as fuel.;;Source: http://www.candu.com/en/home/default.aspx;There are 11 reactors with this technology in the world with installed powers around 700MW. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From land transformation and construction operations.

The activity ends with the dismantling of the plant after use. The decomissioning is projected to last about 50 years, with a dormancy period, where maintenance activities occur, the buildings dismantling and the site reclamation. 
This datasets includes:
- the most important materials used for the construction of the plant and the associated infrastructures: cement, gravel, steel, copper, lead, aluminium;
- operations and machinery for construction
- and use;
- decommissioning and waste treatment
The dataset does not include:
-The maintenance operations during the dormancy period;
-The site reclamation operations
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Between 1982 and 2012 but assumed to be equivalent to present construction (energy, explosives and op√©rations)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data collected for Quebec. Uncertainty adjusted accordngly
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data refer to Gentilly-2 nuclear power plant, the only nuclear facility in Quebec. The Gentilly-2 CANDU pressurized heavy water reactor (PHWR) has a gross output of 675 MWe.;The nuclear plant includes as main components:;-CANDU reactor;-Moderator system;-Heat transport system;-Turbine generator system;-Reactor regulator system;-Management systems (water, heavy water, liquid wastes, gas effluents);-Spent fuel stockage;-Solid radioactive wastes stockage;-Energy systems (auxiliary system, batteries, etc.);-Buildings
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolation from regional dataset. Uncertainty is adjusted accordingly
